Category: Programs Policy No: 4604
Trauma System Date: 01/01/01
EMS Dispatching
EMS DISPATCHING
I. PURPOSE
To summarize the dispatching methodology to be utilized for trauma patients.
II. RELATED POLICIES
A. EMS Aircraft, #5100
B. Emergency Medical Dispatch Policy, #4200
C. Trauma Triage and Destination Guideline Policy # 4613
III. DEFINITIONS
A. Emergency Medical Dispatch (EMD) refers to the use of an organized system for
dispatching that includes a prioritized determination of the need for certain levels
of response and the provision of telephone instructions to callers, assisting them
to provide care to patients while awaiting the arrival of specified system
responders.
IV. POLICY
A. Emergency Medical Dispatching shall continue as currently configured. This
configuration includes the following features:
1. Available to all emergency callers;
2. Dispatch Guidelines approved by the EMS Medical Director;
3. Provided by two (2) dispatch centers within Marin County;
4. Mutual aid resources, including air resources, accessed only through the
County Communications Center.
